item.title: Cracking the Coding Interview Notes
item.description: Overview Don’t get stuck in the coding interview. The book Cracking the Coding Interview is a popular resource that assists in preparing for the technical interview process. 1. Listen & Clarify Pay very close attention to any info in the problem description. You need it all for an optimal algorithm. Listen to the specifics of the interviewers question Ask clarifying questions and state assumptions Communicate back your understanding of the problem

item.title: Slack Best Practices
item.description: Introduction It is April of 2021, and we have been living for more than a year in the pandemic. As a result, it has meant that we all are spending a significant amount of time working, socializing and entertaining ourselves digitally. I work for a burgeoning startup focused on improving the private aviation space. Our firm makes extensive use of Slack as our primary means of communication. The intent of this blog post is to capture some practices to improve the collaboration experience in Slack.

item.title: Designing Your Life
item.description: Designing Your Life Notes Be Curious Curiosity makes everything new Try Stuff Bias to action Try and fail fast Learn by doing Prototype Reframe Problems Reframe to get unstuck Step back, examine your biases, open up to different perspective Know it’s a Process Life gets messy Protypes don’t workout It is a journey not a destination Ask for Help Radical Collaboration It takes a team Use Mentors / team sport Designers Ask How do I … How can I … How might we improve upon this … Examples

item.title: Math Coding Problems - Interview Problems
item.description: Some common math coding exercises used as interview programming questions isPrime An algorigthm to compute a Prime Number which is greater than 1 and only divisbile by one and itself. For example Prime numbers are 1,2,3,5,7,11,13,17.. Problem: Given a number n the function must determine if n is prime and return true/false. 1boolean isPrime(int n) { 2 for (int x=2; x*x <=n; x++) { 3 if (n % x == 0) { 4 return false; 5 } 6 } 7 return true; 8} Time Complexity: Analyzing this code fragment has a time complexity of o(n/2)

item.title: The art of the spike
item.description: Art of Spike Spike is used to finding out the missing element of the user story to complete. Developer has to estimate the spike story during the Sprint planning session. Why a Spike The reason to introduce a spike is that further analysis is required to determine the fesability to implement a technical solution is required. Also, when further study is required to determine the associated risk and/or cost benefits of functional solution options

item.title: How to use Analog to cope with Digital World - BulletJournel
item.description: Why create a Bullet journal About a year and half ago I was introduced to the concept of the Bullet Journal as a GTD tool. As a software engineer one might wonder why an analog tool. The simplicity of a notebook that is follows the Buillet Journal structure as outline below. A key aspect that I appreciate is the Index structure allows me to quickly navigate. No blue-light making it a great way to review tasks.

item.title: My first hugo post
item.description: What is HUGO? Hugo is a static web site generation tool Written in Go Lang Content is written in markdown Good for blogs, static sites How to setup a blog site like this? 10 minute hugo/GitHubPages Update config.toaml baseURL = "https://<username|company>.github.io/" languageCode = "en-us" title = "Blog name" theme = "newsroom" author = "iforster" copyright = "Copyright © 2021, <First and Last Name>" canonifyurls = true paginate = 6 [markup] [markup.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is: Ian Forster My profile: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/ianmforster](LinkedIn: ianmforster) Under the hood Hugo is the world’s fastest framework for building websites. It is written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.com/russross/blackfriday https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop https://github.com/spf13/cobra https://github.com/spf13/viper Learn more and contribute on GitHub.
